This game used to be good and now I dont even know what to say about it. It used to be so much easier, but now it feels heavily killer sided. The hooks feel like they are literally 2 steps away from one another and no matter where I crawl or run off to i turn around there is a hook. The killers abilities are really stupid for some of them, as well as the new matchmaking skill. The matchmaking system used to be so much better before, but now however the hell it is the ranking system sucks, and I constantly feel like I am going against smurfs and tryhards and it definitely pisses off new players. The solo queue experience sucks, and none of my friends play this game cause it is honestly that bad. The maps suck all the small ones like dead dog saloon, preschool maps, the school map, and haddonfield all SUCK. They were all reworked and they still suck more people off then pornstars.  I used to play this game very heavily on console and switched over to pc. It sucks all of it sucks, if I was to go back on console I bet I would still have the issues that I have on here. Fix the game.....
nie

Very telling when the top reviews are talking about how they hate this game but can't put it down. Unfortunately for Behavior Interactive, I don't have Stockholm Syndrome.

Imagine a game that would benefit massively from voice chat, but does not include it. A game with a great premise that does literally nothing to live up to that interesting premise. This game has a godawful DLC scheme on top of a history of critical bugs such as deleted progress.  The developers do not care. They see the players as walking wallets willing to effectively simp and buy the content as a coping mechanism for their Stockholm Syndrome; they think this content will make the game at least a little better, so they will buy as often as they can.

Does that sound like fun to you? No? Don't play.

Really enjoyable game when playing with friends, especially in custom matches where you can just fuck around. Public matches are fun as both survivor or killer but too many camping killers and toxic survivors.
Main problem right now is the matchmaking system, playing a killer in ash rank and going against a 4 stack of survivors with one or two in gold rank should not be allowed because of the clear skill gap.
Otherwise a genuinely enjoyable game, always looking forward to the new killers added!

Terribly game sadly, just no real work put into it aside from cash grabs.

As for balance its pretty terrible, the game will queue with only max lvl characters no matter what (And after like a 6 min queue) so if you're just starting out you will only be going up against people with (quite literally) more lives than you, faster movement then you, more utility than you, and better consumable items to give themselves an edge and control which map you spawn on so that its worst for you and best for them.

Furthering from that, the game play is does not play at all as advertised, the killer is pretty slow and week, there are many ways in which a survivor can overpower them through use of items they brought into the game through being higher lvl, or through use of a pretty terrible crafted environment. Aside from that it has a sorta fun, non-engaging playstyle that could be fun if it weren't so meta oriented. 

Most of the games characters on the survivors side are actually quite unplayable. They have perks and abilities that make them leagues above everybody else, offering game changing boons like surviving hits that would otherwise lose you the game, to gaining access to dodges or quick heals, or other things that make you virtually unkillable. That or their perks are virtually useless and you should not play that character lol. You won't find a lot of variety and you will find yourself playing one of the few meta characters 

Its even worst as the hunter sadly, most of the hunters cant be played, plain and simple sadly. Their abilities can end up doing more harm then help, rendering you in a match you are guaranteed to lose. Only super meta builds and strategies will ever give you an edge, and all of them are boring and repetitive as crazy. You don't ever actually feel like you're hunting anybody or anything at all, and the super meta hunters don't even play in such a way as to make the game exciting, they're super point and click + a lot of walking around doing nothing but painfully managing generators and occasionally hunting a survivor. Even when you win it will still feel boring because you know they only lost because they were stupid for not following the really strict meta and that they were mechanically disadvantaged.

TL;DR

Game takes a massive time investment to get to max lvl and you will be severely disadvantaged until you do, has a super strict and unforgiving meta, and the play style is dry and repetitive with no exiting or new things ever happening. 

Might be fun with a group of 5 friends

otimo jogo de estrategia e cooperativo

Very unique 1v4 multiplayer game whose fun varies from game to game. Some matches as either killer or survivor can be heart-pounding fun, while other matches feel painful and drawn out, as if the other team is purposely torturing you. That being said, it's way more fun than frustration, just be prepared to find an opponent with 2k hours and a desire to make you feel sad. Overall, a great solo experience as a killer and a fun group experience to play with friends. 5 man custom games are the most ideal if you can grab 4 other friends.

I enjoy this game a lot and the developers seem to be responsive to community feedback and quickly roll out updates and fixes. With how old the game is now, you'd expect updates to have slowed down but BHVR have been doing the opposite with expansions and complete overhauls of existing mechanics and maps. I'm happy to support this game.
